content:
I want to make a def for the linear projection of a subspace along its complement but as a map from the full space to itself, i.e., U.subtype ∘ₗ U.linearProjOfIsCompl V hUV (docs#Submodule.linearProjOfIsCompl). This is useful since it satisfies IsIdempotentElem. (Also, docs#Submodule.starProjection as a linear map would equal this.)

What should I call this though? My thoughts are either IsCompl.idempotent or Submodule.IsCompl.idempotent. Maybe projection instead of idempotent? What do y'all think?

I feel like IsCompl.projection (or Submodule.IsCompl.projection) has a nice ring to it since we have docs#Submodule.starProjection.
